017package org.apache.juneau.bean.atom;
018
019import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.StringUtils.*;
020import static org.apache.juneau.xml.annotation.XmlFormat.*;
021
022import java.net.*;
023
024import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.xml.*;
026import org.apache.juneau.xml.annotation.*;
027
028/**
029 * Base class for all Atom elements, providing common attributes.
030 *
031 * <p>
032 * This abstract class defines attributes that can appear on any Atom element. Per RFC 4287,
033 * all Atom elements may have <c>xml:base</c> and <c>xml:lang</c> attributes for managing
034 * URIs and language context.
035 *
036 * <p>
037 * Common attributes:
038 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
039 *    <li><b>xml:base</b> - Establishes a base URI for resolving relative references
040 *    <li><b>xml:lang</b> - Indicates the natural language of the element's content
041 * </ul>
042 *
043 * <p>
044 * This class is extended by all Atom bean classes ({@link Feed}, {@link Entry}, {@link Link},
045 * {@link Person}, {@link Category}, {@link Text}, etc.).
046 *
047 * <h5 class='figure'>Schema</h5>
048 * <p class='bschema'>
049 *    atomCommonAttributes =
050 *       attribute xml:base { atomUri }?,
051 *       attribute xml:lang { atomLanguageTag }?,
052 *       undefinedAttribute*
053 * </p>
054 *
055 * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
056 * <p class='bjava'>
057 *    <jc>// Set base URI for relative link resolution</jc>
058 *    Feed <jv>feed</jv> = <jk>new</jk> Feed(...)
059 *       .setBase(<js>"http://example.org/"</js>);
060 *
061 *    <jc>// Set language</jc>
062 *    Text <jv>title</jv> = <jk>new</jk> Text(<js>"text"</js>)
063 *       .setText(<js>"My Feed"</js>)
064 *       .setLang(<js>"en"</js>);
065 * </p>
066 *
067 * <h5 class='section'>Specification:</h5>
068 * <p>
069 * Represents <c>atomCommonAttributes</c> in the
070 * <a class="doclink" href="https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4287#section-2">RFC 4287 - Section 2</a> specification.
071 *
072 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
073 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauBeanAtom">juneau-bean-atom</a>
074 *    <li class='extlink'><a class="doclink" href="https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4287">RFC 4287 - The Atom Syndication Format</a>
075 * </ul>
076 */
077public abstract class Common {
078
079   private URI base;
080   private String lang;
081
082   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
083   // Bean properties
084   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
085
086   /**
087    * Bean property getter:  <property>base</property>.
088    *
089    * <p>
090    * Returns the base URI for resolving relative URI references (xml:base attribute).
091    *
092    * <p>
093    * This attribute, defined by XML Base, establishes a base URI for resolving any
094    * relative references within the scope of this element. This is particularly useful
095    * when aggregating content from multiple sources.
096    *
097    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
098    */
099   @Xml(prefix="xml", format=ATTR)
100   public URI getBase() {
101      return base;
102   }
103
104   /**
105    * Bean property setter:  <property>base</property>.
106    *
107    * <p>
108    * Sets the base URI for resolving relative URI references (xml:base attribute).
109    *
110    * <p>
111    * The value can be of any of the following types: {@link URI}, {@link URL}, {@link String}.
112    * Strings must be valid URIs.
113    *
114    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
115    * <p class='bjava'>
116    *    Feed <jv>feed</jv> = <jk>new</jk> Feed(...)
117    *       .setBase(<js>"http://example.org/"</js>);
118    * </p>
119    *
120    * @param value
121    *    The new value for this property.
122    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
123    * @return This object.
124    */
125   public Common setBase(Object value) {
126      this.base = toURI(value);
127      return this;
128   }
129
130   /**
131    * Bean property getter:  <property>lang</property>.
132    *
133    * <p>
134    * Returns the natural language of the element's content (xml:lang attribute).
135    *
136    * <p>
137    * The language tag should be a language identifier as defined by RFC 3066. This attribute
138    * is inherited by child elements, so it need only be specified on the highest-level
139    * element where it applies.
140    *
141    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
142    */
143   @Xml(prefix="xml", format=ATTR)
144   public String getLang() {
145      return lang;
146   }
147
148   /**
149    * Bean property setter:  <property>lang</property>.
150    *
151    * <p>
152    * Sets the natural language of the element's content (xml:lang attribute).
153    *
154    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
155    * <p class='bjava'>
156    *    Text <jv>title</jv> = <jk>new</jk> Text(<js>"text"</js>)
157    *       .setText(<js>"Mon Blog"</js>)
158    *       .setLang(<js>"fr"</js>);
159    * </p>
160    *
161    * @param value
162    *    The new value for this property (e.g., "en", "fr", "de", "en-US").
163    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
164    * @return This object.
165    */
166   public Common setLang(String value) {
167      this.lang = value;
168      return this;
169   }
170
171   @Override /* Object */
172   public String toString() {
173      return XmlSerializer.DEFAULT_SQ.toString(this);
174   }
175}
